snippet: The retail report bucked the trend of recent labor data that had suggested the economy was on solid ground despite fears of a possible recession.
abstract: Commerce Dept reports retail sales did not fall as far as expected in February, but large downward revision of January data could lead to renewed concerns about United States economy's prospects for growth; reports retail sales fell 0.1 percent.
lead_paragraph: The retail report bucked the trend of recent labor data that had suggested the economy was on solid ground despite fears of a possible recession.

headline.main: Weak Retail Sales Cause Concern About Growth
headline.print_headline: Weak Retail Sales Renew Concerns About Growth
